medical_history.chief_complaint: Concerns about grandiosity, impulsivity, decreased sleep, and increased alcohol use.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately two months before presentation, marked by a significant increase in energy, decreased need for sleep, racing thoughts, impulsive spending, and risk-taking behaviors. The patient started drinking again 3.5 years after a period of sobriety, consuming 1 pint of vodka daily. Symptoms worsened over the three days before presentation, characterized by agitation and impulsivity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of alcohol-use disorder, multiple traumatic rib fractures with pneumothoraxes from a motor vehicle accident, previous episodes of severe depression, atrial flutter, hypertension, dyslipidemia, strokes, and cerebral white-matter disease.
medical_history.family_history: Father had one psychiatric hospitalization and died of stomach cancer; brother had schizophrenia; mother died of heart failure. No family history of substance-use disorder, stroke, or suicide.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked 1 to 2 packs of cigarettes daily for 40 years. The patient was born and raised in the Boston area, completed community college, and worked as a sales manager. Lives with wife in New England; has two adult children.
